page.title: 01ODIHAM AND THE WOODLANDS
page.content: Odiham is a small, rural town situated in north-east Hampshire, 42 miles from London. At North Warnborough, the junction of the M3 provides access to Southampton and London. The land is divided equally between woodland and farmland. The farmland is used for grazing and growing crops. Dense woodland areas, dominated by mature, deciduous trees cover Odiham Common, Broad Oak Common, Dogmersfield Park, the banks of the Basingstoke Canal and the River Whitewater.Public foot-paths and tow-paths provide access to these areas. Features of local, historical interest, include Odiham Castle, the Great Chalk Pit, Odiham Firs, All Saints Church, the Pest House, the Almshouses and period houses and cottages in the Bury and High Street. The main shopping area is in the High Street.
